intro: Bonamia umbellata, commonly known as the white wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Bonamia umbellata is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Its delicate appearance and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
